message.content: This question requires knowledge about the boiling point of hexane. Hexane has a boiling point of approximately 69 degrees Celsius, so when its temperature goes above 70 degrees Celsius, it will boil. Option (A) is incorrect because melting refers to the solidification of a substance, which is not applicable to hexane. Option (B) is incorrect because sublimation refers to the process of a substance transitioning directly from a solid to a gas, which is also not applicable to hexane. Option (D) is incorrect because freezing refers to the process of a substance transitioning from a liquid to a solid, which is not applicable to hexane either.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of hexane and how temperature affects its state. Hexane is a liquid at room temperature, but when its temperature goes above 70 degrees celsius, it reaches its boiling point and undergoes a phase change from a liquid to a gas. Option (A) is incorrect because melting refers to the change from a solid to a liquid. Option (B) is incorrect because sublimation refers to when a substance goes directly from a solid to a gas without passing through the liquid state. Option (D) is incorrect because freezing refers to the change from a liquid to a solid.

Option (A) is incorrect because melting refers to the transformation from a solid to a liquid, which does not apply to hexane. Option (D) is incorrect because freezing refers to the transformation from a liquid to a solid, which is not relevant to hexane at temperatures above 70 degrees Celsius.
